content: The Act titled "Middle Class Tax Relief Act of 1998" amends the Internal Revenue Code of 1986. Any changes in tax rates under this Act will not be considered as a rate change for tax purposes. The Congress finds a budget surplus in 1998 and proposes a plan to pay off debt, restore trust funds, and provide tax relief to Americans.
